mardigras.title: Mardi Gras LLM
mardigras.description: I partnered with the Advocate for a school project to develop an AI chatbot for Mardi Gras. The chatbot was able to answer questions historical and upcoming questions about Mardi Gras using the Advocate's articles.

w&w.title: When & Wear
w&w.description: When & Wear is a fashion delivery service that brings clothing and accessories from local boutiques to your door. It was made as a pitch for a school project and ranked first in all categories at multiple competitions.

hgc.title: Hand Gesture Contoller
hgc.description: This project is a static gesture detector that allows you to press computer keys using hand symbol. It uses computer vision techniques to recognize predefined hand gestures and trigger corresponding actions..

hic.title: Beni Bolt
hic.description: This project aims to provide users with easy access to detailed information about Louisiana Medicaid, U.S. government Medicare, and general health insurance questions through a chatbot interface. The chatbot is powered by OpenAI's GPT-3.5 model and utilizes LangChain for efficient data retrieval and response generation, with a Chroma database storing pre-processed, vector-embedded document data. Our Django backend handles API requests and data management, while the React frontend offers an intuitive user interface styled with Material UI.

polyglotter.title: Polyglotter
polyglotter.description: Polyglotter is a language guessing game inspired by Wordle.

Sudoku.title: Sudoku Generater & Solver
Sudoku.description: This project was a Sudoku generator and solver that was developed as a small side project. It uses a brute force method with eliminations.

rl.title: Reinforcement Learning
rl.description: This is placeholder for all of the reinforcement learning projects I have created. I have followed many only tutorials to create various trainers primarily in video games.

security.title: File System Security Manager
security.description: This project was a file system security manager that was developed for a school project. It was able to manage user permissions and file access.

huehunt.title: Hue Hunt
huehunt.description: Hue Hunt is a game where you have to navigate your character to the correct tile as fast as possible. It is an endless game comprised of a randomly generated map every single round. There is also 3 modes: easy, medium, and hard. You can also change your sprite using a drop down list. The game has a start screen, in-game screen, and a game over screen. There is a main menu and in-game background noise as well as footsteps, game over, and new round noise. It would also work with an ardunio.

joat.title: Jacks Of All Trades
joat.description: This was a project for CSC 3380 (Object Oriented Design). This was a skill learning website to try fun easy to learn things. The website is now depricated, but it was a great learning expierence.

bugsmash.title: Bug Smash
bugsmash.description: I built a mouse clicker game that involves trying to smash as many bugs as possible in a given amount of time.

food.title: Food Around the World
food.description: This project was an ‘Around the World’ themed restaurant using a Database Management System (DBMS) that will help simplify and streamline the manager’s inventory management and have a centralized place for customer interactions with the application.

lexeme.title: Lexical Analyser
lexeme.description: CSC 4101 Project which involved developing a lexical analyser to learn more about programming languages.

wordle.title: Wordle Cheater
wordle.description: This was a program developed that used a trie to quickly figure out what are possible wordle options based on what you have guessed so far.

planet.title: Planet PFT 1269
planet.description: This was a program I developed alongside a group of incoming college freshman for a competition. I had to learn some basic python, so I could teach the team. We built a choose your own adventure and survival game which took first place.
